The future of America as we know is now at stake, OK? It's that serious. Before we get our guest, we have one more important breaking story at this hour tonight. We are now learning, according to "The Daily Caller," that George Soros, his backed group paid firms tied to Fusion GPS and Christopher Steele nearly $4 million in 2017 to provide research into government entities. That's roughly three times what the DNC and the Clinton campaign paid in 2016. The outcome is the same. Collusion, let's see? A 9-month FBI report, two congressional investigations and, yes, the Mueller report -- definitive, no collusion, a hoax. All right. Joining us now with reaction to this, and our top story on immigration, former U.S. Border Patrol chief under Obama, Mark Morgan. Fox News contributor Sarah. Mark, I just ask you -- I mean, Jeh Johnson is saying what you are doing. You're saying what you're saying. Everybody else in the media, the Democratic Party, there is no crisis at the border. But in the last term of Barack Obama, those same Democrats supported building a wall, paying to build a wall, thought there was a crisis, it was real, and when President Trump even offered Dreamers and DACA as part of the deal, they wouldn't sit down with him for 5 minutes to negotiate. Why?

utterances.speaker: MARK MORGAN, FORMER BORDER PATROL CHIEF UNDER OBAMA
utterances.utterance: Look, that's because they do not want to give the president a victory on this issue. As a law enforcement officer, I can draw no other conclusion. Congress has failed to create legislation to fix the asylum laws and (INAUDIBLE) you just saw precedents -- they failed to give the experts the tools and resources they need still today with incontrovertible evidence, they still refused to admit there's a crisis. The billions of dollars that we've given the Northern Triangle countries has gone nowhere, and had no impact. And, Mexico, they have gone from total, inept bystanders to facilitators. We have a crisis and the president's absolutely right to threaten to close the border.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. You've been down there for us, on your own, multiple times, Sara Carter. I've been down there, what, 10, 12, 14 times, I can't count the actual number. I've seen it up close and person. I've been on a drug warehouse, I've seen tunnels, I even saw a gang member arrested. We have it all on tape. And for those that say manufactured, why? Why was it not manufactured in a second term of Obama but it is because of Trump? Do you agree with Mark?

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I absolutely agree with Mark. It's based on facts. We knew in 2014, Sean, when I was in Texas, along the Rio Grande Valley sector, and there was a flood of unaccompanied minors coming in, even President Obama himself called it a crisis. Democrats in the region called it a crisis. I can tell you this. The facts speak for themselves. Since 2010, we've seen an increase of unaccompanied minors of 169 percent. Since 2013, we have seen an increase of family unit of over 670 percent. In 2010, there was one out of every 100 would ask for asylum. Now, it's one out of every 10. We know for a fact, and these are based on facts, that the drug cartels and the criminal trafficking organizations are basically advertising this. They are basically saying, look, we are going to get you in, let's go to end before Trump shuts down the border. And we know that there are groups within Central America and other parts of Mexico that are actually funneling money to get these people up here and through the border. There are tens of thousands of people waiting to come into this country illegally and many of them haven't even been accounted for. Border Patrol and ICE do not have the resources that they need in order to be able to accurately determine how many people have actually snuck into the country already. So, we're left with all of these questions. This is a huge crisis. It's a national security issue. It's a human rights issue because all of these young people that are being traffic are not always with their parents. They are with strangers and some of them are being sex traffic into the United States.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you this -- how many people, Mark, how many criminal aliens -- I will concede, 98 percent want a better life, they probably see the walls going up I may see things tightening up and up and they say, let me get in quick, which I would argue is -- at least they believe the president. The president obviously didn't have an override to his veto. That means $9 billion allocated, reallocated, not to spend from the Defense Department on the other monies he is available. It's going to go up fairly expeditiously, knowing the president, he does keep promises. So, my question is, how many more homicides have to take place? How many more Angel Moms and Dads do we need? How many more hundreds of Americans every week dying from the 90 percent of heroine crossing that border, before people see what Sarah sees, what you see, what Jeh Johnson sees, what I see, and clearly what Donald Trump sees?

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.utterance: Sean, that's the question. And from a law enforcement perspective, I've been doing this for 30 years, I don't understand. Sara is spot on. The American people need to understand that because the Border Patrol is pulled off the line to handle the humanitarian -- I call it day care provider issues -- is that border now is even more wide open. We have no idea what is getting through, but we know the cartels are exploiting this humanitarian crisis to bring additional bad things and bad people into this country. We have no idea who's coming in.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sara, last word.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Well, this is the first time we have a president in office that actually wants to do something about the border. Congress better listen because I believe the president is going to stand by his words and that border will be shut. And, believe me, there's a lot of people backing him on that issue as well.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Thank you both. Very important, very informative, and things you won't get elsewhere. All right. We have a busy news night. Senator Graham's reaction to James Comey talking President Trump. Also -- OK, we have tonight, Alec Baldwin is being sued. He now has to go to anger management classes. Try to pick a fight with me. I have the single best tapes of Alec Baldwin of his most insane meltdowns, a “Hannity” exclusive. If you know Alec, tell him to tune in as soon as possible. He doesn't want to miss it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: "The Daily Caller" tonight reporting that the Soros-backed Democracy Integrity Project paid firms tied to Fusion GPS and Christopher Steele, the foreign agent, a whopping $3.8 million in 2017. Why? To dig up dirt on, quote, government entities. Now, despite all that we have uncovered, night after night, James Comey, he's continuing to remain defiant, insisting that he has nothing to hide. Try to remind him many times, Jimbo, you have the right to remain quiet. You may want to exercise that right as you dig a deeper hole every day. Like, oh, signing off on a FISA warrant, saying it's verified, and telling Trump it's salacious but unverified months later. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: JAMES COMEY, FORMER FBI DIRECTOR
utterances.utterance: Investigate what? To investigate the investigations we're conducting? What would be the crime you'd be investigating? So it's a terrible cycle to start. He's already started, calling for the locking t up of his political opponents, including people like me. So it would just be more of that dangerous step and I would hope, although they continue to disappoint me, the Republicans would finally stand up and say, we don't do that kind of thing. But me, personally, asked me questions, go ahead. I'd like to answer them in the daylight if I could.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I would like to see that, too. We know a lot more than we did before. Here with reaction, Senate Judiciary Committee chairman, Senator Lindsey Graham. When the president was on this program last week, Senator, the president said very clearly, he will -- there will be a cascade of information. Doug Collins today releasing yet another closed door conversation, Bill Priestap, in this very particular case, very revealing. Then we're going to get the FISA applications, aren't we?

utterances.speaker: SEN. LINDSEY GRAHAM, R-S.C.
utterances.utterance: I hope so.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The Grassley-Graham memo said bulk of information came from the phony Hillary bought and paid for Russian dossier. Interesting. Then, we are going to have a Gang of Eight information, and we'll get 302 information. Democrats aren't asking for their transparency, but we will get it, and you will continue. You've made that promise to us.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes. Let me tell you why, because millions of Americans believe at the top level of the Department of Justice and the FBI, they wanted Clinton to win and Trump to lose. They manipulated the law to let her off, manipulated the facts and the law to go after Trump, and that's the big deal to a lot of people, Republicans and some independents. So, I promise you, former Director Comey will get to testify in the light of day. I'll ask him about the dossier, was it the chief reason you got a warrant against Carter Page? Is it verified to this day? If there's a counterintelligence investigation open against the Trump campaign, why didn't you tell Trump about it so he could do something like you told Feinstein? And at the end of the day, how could you write that Clinton did nothing wrong even before you interviewed her and why did you interview here with two people in the room, her aides, and not under oath? Most people don't get that treatment.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right. So, the important thing is, your committee will take over where the House Intel Committee left off. It gives you a big leg up. But then I don't know at what point a lot of this information will be released. I believe the president is serious when he says that information is coming out. You raise a lot of other questions with Comey. I would argue, as Gregg Jarrett and others, lawyers, on this program, have argued, that there is a vulnerability for Comey. There is a vulnerability for Strzok and Page. There's a vulnerability for McCabe. We know criminal referrals will be coming this week from Devin Nunes, a number of them.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So the criminality, it's not my job to find out crimes were committed. It's my job as oversight of the executive branch, did they bend the rules, did they break the rules to get an outcome? Did they mislead the FISA court? Do we need to change the rules about FISA courts? Are there any rules at all about counterintelligence operations? Why did you not tell Trump? You told Feinstein she had somebody on her staff working with China. Why didn't you go to Trump and tell him about suspicions about Russia? Was it a back door attempt to get in his campaign? Some prosecutor, not a politician, needs to look at Comey, McCabe and all of these characters to find out if in fact they broke the law. And I'm hoping Attorney General Barr will assign somebody to this case with the same resources and commitment to look at them as Mueller had to look at Trump.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let's look really quickly at the border crisis that is going on, even hearing from--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --Barack Obama's Director of Homeland Security yesterday--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --Mark, who we had on earlier in the program. Real crisis. But--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --Donald Trump, his veto was not overridden. That money will be re-appropriated. $9 billion. The President tried to work with Democrats. The things they say they wanted, they wouldn't sit down with him.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: In a way, it's actually a bigger victory for the President, more money than he ever dreamed of, probably enough to get a real good chunk of this done and complete. But I think these other countries see what's happening, and they're trying to get to that border as quickly as possible knowing it won't be open as long as maybe they thought.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So I asked the head of the Border Patrol, do you need a wall? And he said, "Absolutely." So the President stood firm. He has more money for a wall than he's ever had because he is willing to declare an emergency and there is one. But he also said if you don't change our laws, the wall won't work. Right now, if you step one foot into the United States and claim asylum, you're entitled to a hearing. We have no place to put you and we release you in the country. If you come here with children, you can only be held 20 days. We'll release you because we have no place to put you. That's why we're being overrun by people from the triangle countries because we can't deport you back to those countries. If you don't change that, you'll never fix this. And I hope Democrats will help us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Lindsey Graham, thank you. We appreciate you - your commitment to go forward, get to the truth, and those that violated laws, they need to be held accountable. We will do that on this program, as we have promised you. When we get back, Dan Bongino, Geraldo Rivera, we'll get their reaction. Yes, now, two more women coming forward as it relates to creepy, crazy Uncle Joe Biden. Later, with special reaction, Alec Baldwin, he's tried to pick a fight with me. You will see tape and hear tape tonight that you will - you never heard before. You're going to love it. I like it, love it. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. So the mainstream media mob divided this week as allegations of, yes, more unwanted touching that has surfaced against creepy, well, crazy Uncle Joe Biden. Now, some are defending this in your face, invasive--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --weird behavior. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: CAROL MOSELEY BRAUN, D-ILL, FORMER SENATOR
utterances.utterance: To make a big kerfuffle out of this with the man who's done nothing but spend his life in the service of others, I think, is just wrong. What else he's supposed to do? "Lucy, I'm sorry, I got too close to you?" I mean, seriously, what else is he supposed to do?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's one person of allegation that's five years old. And that cannot negate or change or diminish in any way Joe Biden's very strong record, empowering women.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE (voice-over)
utterances.utterance: There's so much about a politician from another school, from those old touchy feely days, put your arm around somebody, give him a hug, give them a kiss. That's the way politicians behaved.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Let me just say it. This is ridiculous. It's completely - it's - the whole thing has gotten - the conversation has gotten out of control.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here with reaction, Fox News contributor, Dan Bongino; Fox News Correspondent-At-Large, Geraldo Rivera. OK. This guy is one - who does this? Then you're a very warm and affectionate guy.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.utterance: I am.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. But you're not him.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But like Joe Biden and like the President of the United States, I come from a generation where that was not that bad. It was pretty accepted, generally speaking.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you try to kiss the women you don't know on the lips?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's funny that their (inaudible) person Bridget (ph) said that you don't sniff a stranger unless you are a dog.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: An absolute great line. I don't know Joe Biden. (Inaudible) couple of times back in the ‘70s.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Look at the grab, the grope, the fondle, the smell, the nose touching--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --by all accounts, he's a great family man. He - he stuck up for President Obama--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Look at that. Geraldo, who does that?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's kind of creepy when you look at it--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --without--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --but he has a - he's highly regarded by a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You've been on a lot of public events.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: People get in your grill. Right?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They do.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And then - and then you're like, OK, you want to step back, then they're getting even closer. And they usually have bad breath. But he's not--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Erica and I - my wife and I debated this, and all of her friends, admittedly they are Democrats say that he is not a sexual predator, he's not - this isn't sexual assault. He may go a little too far--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He grabs your wife by the neck and kisses your wife on the lips, how are you going to feel?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I would - I would whack him. I would whack him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You make it personal, and Geraldo changes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Dan - look, it's that, but then the - and I want to get your comments on that. And then there's a real serious side. Where are all the I-believe people? Gayle King doing these interviews with these women alleging rape. And--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And they told people at the time - no I-believers here. No - where are the I-believe, believe-the-women? Where are - where's that group? I guess--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Who's alleging rape?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, that's in the case of Lieutenant Governor--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh, that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --of Virginia.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Sean, this is why I could never be a liberal. I mean, being a liberal requires you to get up in the morning, look in the mirror and be a total fake and a fraud. Conservatives have been entirely consistent on this. Women are to be taken absolutely seriously, any victim for that m after. They're to be respected. But evidence is to be believed. Everybody can't be believed any time. Anybody can make up a charge against anyone. Thankfully, it doesn't happen often. But we have a system that affords people due process. Conservatives have never changed on that. Liberals came out on Kavanaugh and anybody aligned with the conservative cause at all and, of course, completely jumped the shark and said, "No, women are to be believed." Well, Sean, what about these women? Why aren't they to be believed? And Sean, there's photographic evidence. And one thing for Geraldo, who is my good buddy. I love Geraldo. No one is accusing Joe Biden being a sexual predator. But can we just be candid here? This is straight up creepy. If this was a guy in a workplace doing this and you had photo evidence, you would run. Did you see that picture, Sean, of him grabbing Hillary, when she was in the blue pantsuit.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Look at the slow-mo. Look at this.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: She--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Hillary looks like she's ready to shoot a double leg takedown to get away from this guy.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: She kicked him away quick enough.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --slow dance.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way, four women are saying they felt invaded here, and seriously.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, those women who felt invaded have a right to say so, and I think it has, in effect, ended his run for the President. You can take my word for it. Starting right now, I think - I think that it is over. And the one I feel bad about is Al Franken who did so much less than the Vice President--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Excuse me--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --and his career ended. What did he do? He faked - he faked something, sleeping women--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He's creepy, too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He's not as creepy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Last word, Dan Bongino.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Listen, Sean, the one thing you never want to be OK as a dude is the close-talker creepy dude.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: You just don't. I don't know what a sophisticated way to say that. You don't want to be the close-talking creepy dude.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I just love Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Sorry, Joe. This race is over.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If it was my wife, what would you do?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I'd whack him. But (inaudible) like grandpa without any teeth (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Very well. All right. The great actor, Alec Baldwin, picking a fight. I've got the best tape you've ever seen. You've got to see this next, and Jesse Watters, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Crazy Alec Baldwin, very angry man, becoming more and more unhinged. Well, he's obsessed with Fox News, talk radio, and even yours truly. We've got our back-and-forth over the years. Just listen to him attacking me, The Great One Mark Levin. He was on with Howard Stern. Take a look and listen.

utterances.speaker: ALEC BALDWIN, AMERICAN ACTOR
utterances.utterance: Hannity is an idiot and he's an untalented idiot.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN (voice-over)
utterances.utterance: He has no talent what-so - he has none.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: But he has--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: He's a ranting - he's like a - he's like a guy who gets (inaudible) like, "what about this immigration, ha? This immigration?" He's like a Long Island working-class buffoon.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: And yet--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: --where everything is just hate. Sean Hannity, who lacks self- awareness on any level. He's got zero self-awareness.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Have you had a discussion with him? Have you--?

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. Why would I waste my time doing that?

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: --horrible broadcaster. Levin is a whacked-out (ph) idiot.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: The things he says are just not interesting.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK, Alec. I'm so dumb. What I do on radio and TV is so easy. Why have you failed a cable TV news show, a network show? And you and I both know you wanted to work in talk radio. You failed and flopped in both of these businesses over and over again. Now, just to remind everybody, Alec Baldwin wanted to be a radio talk show host. One day, he was given a chance to try out at a New York station that I worked at. So I called in, The Great One Mark Levin called in. Something really interesting happened. Watch.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN WHITMAN, THE BRIAN WHITMAN SHOW, WABC RADIO
utterances.utterance: Sean Hannity?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is that Brian Whitman?

utterances.speaker: WHITMAN
utterances.utterance: Hi, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Alec, I wanted to give you an official WABC welcome, considering you were supposed to come on my program last week and you - you didn't show up. What happened?

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: No, I wasn't supposed to come on your program, Sean Hannity.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't dream of coming on your program, Sean Hannity. I'm here with Brian. I'm here with a really talented--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --that you are. You don't tell the truth.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: I'm here with a really talented broadcaster. Why would I want to come on the show with a no-talent former construction worker hack like you?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Are you the guy that said that our Vice President, while we're at war, while we're leading troops in harm's way, are you the reckless third- rate Hollywood actor that--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: --all the acid venom spewing and the hatred. It is Sean Hannity.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, you're the one--

utterances.speaker: MARK LEVIN, RADIO TALK SHOW HOST
utterances.utterance: --actually we've only just begun. Are you 40 or 50 pounds overweight now?

utterances.speaker: WHITMAN
utterances.utterance: Oh, come on now. Who is--?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's the (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WHITMAN
utterances.utterance: Oh, Mark Levin is--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. I wish I could play the whole thing. Have to be and completely embarrassed. Baldwin got so angry. He left his own show that he was hosting, walked out of his own talk show, nowhere to be found. Now, he was the host of Brian Whitman, a good friend of ours. He brought in and helped him get through his first show. Listen to how this ended.

utterances.speaker: WHITMAN
utterances.utterance: Listen, Sean--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You don't have courage to debate--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WHITMAN
utterances.utterance: Come back. Come back. Alec, come back. They are gone. Alec? Alec has walked out of the studio. Alec, please come - please come back. He is in the other room. Alec Baldwin has put on his jacket. And he has left. I just went into the station lobby to the elevator bank to see if I can find Alec Baldwin and ask him to please return to the radio show, but he is gone.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Alec wasn't done trying out for talk radio. He thinks, "all right, I won't go to a station they know" and went to our affiliate in Philadelphia, WPHT. I have to admit - Alec, I give you credit. This is the greatest tape in the history of radio. So good because you are so bad. Watch.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: When can we take some calls, Ivan (ph)?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Whenever we want.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: Do we have calls that are on there now?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: No calls yet. No calls yet.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: No calls yet. Why didn't (ph) people call to get on the air? I mean, do we have that number?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's right in there and--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: Oh, do I have the call number in front of me? Oh, I'm so sorry. That's interesting. Interesting. Do we have any calls yet there, Ivan (ph)? No calls. Let's read some more about scientology. Is Sean Hannity, a scientologist - Alec Baldwin posing the big questions tonight here. Do we have any calls here yet, Ivan (ph)? None. Boy! It's just incredible.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That was a real trap. No calls. So eventually he just called his mother to be the caller. And we can't forget ever Alec's lowlights. This is only a small sampling.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I hope you choke to death.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.utterance: Do you hear what I said?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.utterance: You got to answer me. Yes or no?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: If you're here when my wife and my kid come out here, you've got a big problem. You know that, don't you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.utterance: You didn't?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: Yes? Yes?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I honestly did not--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: Yes? Do you want to apologize to my family?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I didn't hit her.

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: I asked you a question. Do you want to apologize to--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I am not--

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN
utterances.utterance: I asked you a question. Can you get the (inaudible) out of here?

utterances.speaker: BALDWIN (voicemail to his daughter)
utterances.utterance: So you better be ready Friday, the 20th, to meet with me, so I'm going to let you know just how I feel about what a rotten little pig you really are.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Out of respect for his daughter and his brother Stephen, I'll just stop there. Because Alec - he had a rough time. TV shows failure, talk radio career collapsed before he even started. You know what, Alec? After you work out your anger management classes and your legal issues and you're being sued today because you fought over a parking spot because you were too cheap to get one yourself, maybe you can try again. And let me be clear. I'm extremely proud 20 years, two decades of my life, yes, son of a prison guard and a family probation court officer, yes, I spent two decades in my life doing every job in a restaurant, construction worker you could ever do. All of them. I'm really proud of it. It makes me who I am today, taught me the value of hard work, helped me understand, you know what, what my grandparents and parents went through. All right. Here with reaction, Jesse Watters, and Geraldo still stays with- -

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Greatest tape ever. Call me. Call me. Ivan (ph), any more call? Call me. JESSE WATTERS, THE FIVE CO-HOST & WATTERS' WORLD HOST: Well, yes. It didn't work out for radio. That's just a money-hungry lawyer trying to shake him down because the guy got his feelings hurt.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: This guy next to you has been in this business 50 years. Have you even dealt with this a time or two?

utterances.utterance: He used to box at my gym. I'd like to promote that fight. I think you'd kick his butt. I think that - Alec - I mean, Jesse is right about his career. If you saw last week, they're so apologetic of getting collusion wrong that I think that that best role of his life is gone.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: OK. First of all, how - he thinks he's insulted me by saying you worked in construction. I'm like, no. How does somebody get that out of touch? That's what I don't understand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't think he's out of touch, Sean. I honestly think he lives in Manhattan. He is not in a little penthouse up top. He's not riding around in limos. He's in the street. He's parking in the street. Who parks in the street, anyway? So he doesn't have an entourage around him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is why he gets a lot of stuff from the press.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Jesse, if somebody takes your parking spot, you don't chase him across the room, you don't get in a woman's face like he just did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, I don't think he knocked the guy's teeth out--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --uncontrollable temper. That's uncontrollable temper.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he's a hot head.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's - he is a hot head.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's a hot head.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He walked out of his own--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean, you don't yell at him--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: He walked out of his own radio talk show host try-out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That wasn't good.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But he really doesn't like you. I mean, I think he feels threatened by you. I think he feels threatened by you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He hates your success.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He is bitter that you were right on the collusion deal--

utterances.utterance: Really. He should be.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.speaker: RIVERA

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's too nice--

utterances.utterance: Defending him.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You've got 600 radio stations. Why do you care about Alec Baldwin.

utterances.utterance: Actually, 623, but who--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Sorry.
